Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BMAP-28-(1-18) (Synthetic AMPs, N-terminal fragment of BMAP-28, XXA, UCLL1c; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (66.67%) tosynthetic SMAP-18G: 22%; L=K=R: 17%. GRAVY: -0.67; M Wt: 2059.483; M formula: C94H160N31O21; Mol ex coeff: 7040.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 ML-35 or D21 (MIC 0.5-1 uM), S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 2 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 1 uM), S. marcescens ATCC 8100 (MIC 2 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923  Cowan 1 or MRSA (MIC 2-4 uM), S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 1 uM), B. megaterium Bm11 (MIC 2 uM), C. albicans (MIC 16 uM), and C. neoformans (MIC 2 uM).Toxicity: Hemolysis is much reduced compared to the parent peptide.Structure: Helical in TFE (CD). NMR found a helical region in the central region in SDS micelles.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. Updated 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: Skerlavaj B, Gennaro R, Bagella L, Merluzzi L, Risso A, Zanetti M. 1996
Literature Information.Title: Biological characterization of two novel cathelicidin-derived peptides and identification of structural requirements for their antimicrobial and cell lytic activities
